NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Distribution and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Gas and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Distribution} and {Emissions} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Gas and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Coal and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gas} and {Emissions} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Transmission and Infrastructure or the cell corresponding to Oil and Investment?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Transmission} and {Infrastructure} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Water and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Distribution and Investment?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Distribution} and {Investment} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.13 to 0.28?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Nuclear, Efficiency), (Waste Management, Efficiency), (Nuclear, Infrastructure), (Nuclear, Policy), (Renewables, Policy), (Renewables, Reliability), (Renewables, Storage), (Water, Storage), (Oil, Technology)}.
